channel.title: Posts on Brad Parbs
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Brad Parbs

item.title: A Beginner’s Guide to the Best Command Line Tools
item.description: As someone who loves the command line, I’m always striving to make my workflow easier, more efficient, and just overall better. Hopefully, by walking through my set up and my recommendations for the best command line tools, you’ll find some nifty tips and tricks you can adapt to make your workflow better too. The command line is a scary place if you’ve never been there before. It is. You can do some really powerful and dangerous things to your computer.

item.title: Getting started with Vagrant & VVV for local development
item.description: When I started doing web development, I think I started the way a lot of us did. You have a site you want to work on, so you connect with FTP, download a file, modify it, upload it back up, and then refresh the page to see if your changes worked. This process doesn’t really work when you’re working with a team of people, or on a site that people are actively going to.

item.title: Setting up WordPress + Nginx + HHVM For The Fastest Possible Load Times
item.description: One of the most enjoyable parts about writing code is writing efficient and performant functionality. No matter how fast your code is, if your server itself isn’t running to it’s maximum performance, you’re not delivering your site as fast as you could be. By setting up Nginx and the new HHVM , you can get your server delivering fully loaded pages faster than most servers answer a request. HHVM is an open-source virtual machine designed for executing programs written in Hackand PHP.
